item.title: The Treasure of Faith in the Life of the Church
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: The great aim of our ministry should be the same as Paul's: to bring about the obedience of faith for the sake of God's glory.

media:content.media:description: The great aim of our ministry should be the same as Paul's: to bring about the obedience of faith for the sake of God's glory.

item.title: The Gospel in the Church for the Obedience of Faith through Spiritual Gifts
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: Grace makes you a debtor, not to God, but to others who need grace.

item.title: The Perils of Disapproving God
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: Every form of evil ultimately comes from failing to know, approve, and love God above all things.

item.title: Doing and Endorsing Evil
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: The gospel of Jesus Christ is the perfect and only remedy for what people already know about themselves.

media:content.media:description: The gospel of Jesus Christ is the perfect and only remedy for what people already know about themselves.

item.title: God's Response to Hypocrisy: Kindness and Judgment
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: God's justice does not demand that he punish us for our sins immediately. His kindness leads him to forbear and to be patient with us, to a point.

media:content.media:title: God's Response to Hypocrisy: Kindness and Judgment
media:content.media:description: God's justice does not demand that he punish us for our sins immediately. His kindness leads him to forbear and to be patient with us, to a point.

item.title: Justification by Faith Is the End of Boasting
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: Boasting matters to Paul because it is the outward form of the inward moral corruption that lies behind all the evils and miseries of the world.

item.title: Justification by Faith Establishes the Law
item.dc:creator: John Piper
item.description: The moral law in the Old Testament is not a ladder for climbing, but a track for riding in the power of the Holy Spirit.

media:content.media:description: The moral law in the Old Testament is not a ladder for climbing, but a track for riding in the power of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: One God and One Salvation for All the Nations
item.dc:creator: John Piper
